medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent right upper quadrant (RUQ) abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports a 3-week period of intermittent RUQ abdominal pain, occurring hours postprandially, significantly worse with a fattier meal. The patient experienced a worse episode this past week, with RUQ abdominal pain radiating to the back, leading to leaving work. Symptoms have included dark urine and decreased oral intake due to increased pain with food.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hypothyroidism, osteoporosis, remote history of gallstones.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and two maternal aunts with cancer; father with coronary artery disease in later life, diabetes mellitus.
